title: Closed walks of a fixed length as words

blocks.name: cclwwlkn
blocks.content: Extend class notation with closed walks (in an undirected graph) of a fixed length as word over the set of vertices.
blocks.origin: const class cclwwlkn { ClWWalksN }

blocks.name: diff.cclwwlkn.s
diff.cclwwlkn.c
diff.cclwwlkn.w
df-clwwlkn
blocks.content: Define the set of all closed walks of a fixed length ` n ` as words over the set of vertices in a graph ` g ` . If ` 0 < n ` , such a word corresponds to the sequence p(0) p(1) ... p(n-1) of the vertices in a closed walk p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0) as defined in ~ df-clwlks . For ` n = 0 ` , the set is empty, see ~ clwwlkn0 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

blocks.content: The set of closed walks of a fixed length ` N ` as words over the set of vertices in a graph ` G ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: isclwwlkn
blocks.content: A word over the set of vertices representing a closed walk of a fixed length. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlkn0
blocks.content: There is no closed walk of length 0 (i.e. a closed walk without any edge) represented by a word of vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: The length of a word representing a closed walk of a fixed length is this fixed length. (Contributed by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlknwwlksn
blocks.content: A word representing a closed walk of length ` N ` also represents a walk of length ` N - 1 ` . The walk is one edge shorter than the closed walk, because the last edge connecting the last with the first vertex is missing. For example, if ` <" a b c "> e. ( 3 ClWWalksN G ) ` represents a closed walk "abca" of length 3, then ` <" a b c "> e. ( 2 WWalksN G ) ` represents a walk "abc" (not closed if ` a =/= c ` ) of length 2, and ` <" a b c a "> e. ( 3 WWalksN G ) ` represents also a closed walk "abca" of length 3. (Contributed by AV, 24-Jan-2022.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: clwwlkinwwlk
blocks.content: If the initial vertex of a walk occurs another time in the walk, the walk starts with a closed walk. Since the walk is expressed as a word over vertices, the closed walk can be expressed as a subword of this word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 23-Jan-2022.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: clwwlkn2
blocks.content: A closed walk of length 2 represented as word is a word consisting of 2 symbols representing (not necessarily different) vertices connected by (at least) one edge. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 25-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlknfi
blocks.content: If there is only a finite number of vertices, the number of closed walks of fixed length (as words) is also finite. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 25-Apr-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by JJ, 18-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlknfi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wcel(co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0), cfn))
} = {
  syl5eqel(co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0), cfn, crab(hs0, cfv(cclwwlk, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  clwwlkn(hs0, c1, c0)
  ssfid(crab(hs0, cfv(cclwwlk, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1)), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  wrdnfi(hs0, cfv(cvtx, c0), c1)
  mp1i(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wss(crab(hs0, cfv(cclwwlk, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1)), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1))), wss(cfv(cclwwlk, c0), cword(cfv(cvtx, c0))))
  clwwlksswrd(c0)
  rabss2(hs0, cfv(cclwwlk, c0), cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cclwwlk, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)))
}

blocks.name: clwwlkfvOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ clwwlkfv as of 12-Oct-2022. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 28-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-Apr-2021.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlkfvOLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3))))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(c3, cwwlksn, c4), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s1, c1, co(cv(s1), csubstr, cop(nat0, c3))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))), wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(c3, cwwlksn, c4), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0)))))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))), diffsc(s0, c4))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))), diffsc(s1, c4))
  fvmpt(s1, c0, c1, c2, co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)), co(cv(s1), csubstr, cop(nat0, c3)))
  oveq1(cv(s1), c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3))
  ovex(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3))
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c3))
  diff.csubstr.s(s1)
  diff.cop.s(s1, nat0, c3)
  diff.nat0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm clwwlkfvOLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >))
  ‚ä£ c1 = { s0 ‚àà(c3[WWalksN]c4)|(lastS ` s0)=(s0 ` 0)}
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s1 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s1[substr]< 0, c3 >))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >)), c1 = { s0 ‚àà(c3[WWalksN]c4)|(lastS ` s0)=(s0 ` 0)})
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >)), d(s0, s1))
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >)), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >)), d(s0, c4))
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ` c0)=(c0[substr]< 0, c3 >)), d(s1, c4))
  fvmpt(s1, c0, c1, c2, (c0[substr]< 0, c3 >), (s1[substr]< 0, c3 >))
  oveq1(s1, c0, csubstr, < 0, c3 >)
  ovex(c0, csubstr, < 0, c3 >)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, csubstr, < 0, c3 >)
  diff.csubstr.s(s1)
  diff.cop.s(s1, nat0, c3)
  diff.nat0.s(s1)
}

thm clwwlkfv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3)))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(c3, cwwlksn, c4), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s1, c1, co(cv(s1), cpfx, c3)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3))), wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(c3, cwwlksn, c4), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0)))))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3))), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3))), diffsc(s0, c4))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), co(c0, cpfx, c3))), diffsc(s1, c4))
  fvmpt(s1, c0, c1, c2, co(c0, cpfx, c3), co(cv(s1), cpfx, c3))
  oveq1(cv(s1), c0, cpfx, c3)
  ovex(c0, cpfx, c3)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cpfx, c3)
  diff.cpfx.s(s1)
}

  ‚ä£ c2 =(s1 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s1[prefix]c3))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
} = {

}

blocks.name: clwwlkf1o
blocks.content: F is a 1-1 onto function, that means that there is a bijection between the set of closed walks of a fixed length represented by walks (as words) and the set of closed walks (as words) of the fixed length. The difference between these two representations is that in the first case the starting vertex is repeated at the end of the word, and in the second case it is not. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 1-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlkf1o(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wf1o(c1, c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s0, co(c0, cwwlksn, c3), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s1, c2, co(cv(s1), cpfx, c0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, cn), wf1o(c1, c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c3)), wf1(c1, c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c3)), wfo(c1, c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c3)))
  clwwlkf1(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  clwwlkfo(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  df-f1o(c1, c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c3))
}

blocks.name: clwwlken
blocks.content: The set of closed walks of a fixed length represented by walks (as words) and the set of closed walks (as words) of the fixed length are equinumerous. (Contributed by AV, 5-Jun-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Nov-2022.)

} = {

  rabex(s0, co(c0, cwwlksn, c1), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0)))
  ovex(c0, cwwlksn, c1)

  eqid(crab(s0, co(c0, cwwlksn, c1), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, co(c0, cwwlksn, c1), wceq(cfv(clsw, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s0), nat0))), co(cv(hs0), cpfx, c0)))

blocks.name: clwwlknwwlksnb
blocks.content: A word over vertices represents a closed walk of a fixed length ` N ` greater than zero iff the word concatenated with its first symbol represents a walk of length ` N ` . This theorem would not hold for ` N = 0 ` and ` W = (/) ` , because ` ( W ++ <" ( W `` 0 ) "> ) ` ` = <" (/) "> e. ( 0 WWalksN G ) ` could be true, but not ` W e. ( 0 ClWWalksN G ) <-> (/) e. (/) ` . (Contributed by AV, 4-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: clwwlkext2edg
blocks.content: If a word concatenated with a vertex represents a closed walk in (in a graph), there is an edge between this vertex and the last vertex of the word, and between this vertex and the first vertex of the word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2018.) (Revised by AV, 27-Apr-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: wwlksext2clwwlk
blocks.content: If a word represents a walk in (in a graph) and there are edges between the last vertex of the word and another vertex and between this other vertex and the first vertex of the word, then the concatenation of the word representing the walk with this other vertex represents a closed walk. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2018.) (Revised by AV, 27-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 14-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtx, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c2))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, co(c1, cwwlksn, c2)), wcel(c3, c4), wi(wa(wcel(cpr(cfv(clsw, c0), c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, cfv(c0, nat0)), c5)), wcel(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), co(co(c1, caddc, nat2), cclwwlkn, c2))))
  mpdan(wcel(c0, co(c1, cwwlksn, c2)), wi(wcel(c3, c4), wi(wa(wcel(cpr(cfv(clsw, c0), c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, cfv(c0, nat0)), c5)), wcel(co(c0, cconcat, cs1(c3)), co(co(c1, caddc, nat2), cclwwlkn, c2)))), w3a(wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(c1, caddc, nat1))))

blocks.name: clwwnisshclwwsn
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting a closed walk as word of fixed length results in a closed walk as word of the same length (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-Apr-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)

thm clwwnisshclwwsn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

blocks.name: clwwlknscsh
blocks.content: The set of cyclical shifts of a word representing a closed walk is the set of closed walks represented by cyclical shifts of a word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlknccat
blocks.content: The concatenation of two words representing closed walks anchored at the same vertex represents a closed walk with a length which is the sum of the lengths of the two walks. The resulting walk is a "double loop", starting at the common vertex, coming back to the common vertex by the first walk, following the second walk and finally coming back to the common vertex again. (Contributed by AV, 24-Apr-2022.)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

  sylc(s0 ‚àà(c2[ClWWalksN]c3), ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà(0[...]c2), s0 =(s0[cyclShift]s3)), s0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c3)), c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï)

blocks.name: erclwwlknsym
blocks.content: ` .~ ` is a symmetric relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Apr-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: erclwwlkn
blocks.content: ` .~ ` is an equivalence relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words) with a fixed length. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Apr-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm erclwwlkn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wer(c0, c1)
  -| wceq(c1, co(c2, cclwwlkn, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c2), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
} = {
  iseri(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1)
  erclwwlknrel(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  erclwwlknsym(hs0, hs1, s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  erclwwlkntr(hs0, hs1, hs2, s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  erclwwlknref(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, c0, c2, c3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.hs2.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: qerclwwlknfi
blocks.content: The quotient set of the set of closed walks (defined as words) with a fixed length according to the equivalence relation ` .~ ` is finite. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Apr-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm qerclwwlknfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wcel(cqs(c1, c2), cfn))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c3), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
} = {
  ssfid(cqs(c1, c2), cpw(c1), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  sylib(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wcel(cpw(c1), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  syl5eqel(c1, cfn, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  clwwlknfi(c0, c3)
  pwfi(c1)
  qsss(c1, c2, wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  a1i(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wer(c2, c1))
  erclwwlkn(s0, s1, s2, c2, c1, c3, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm qerclwwlknfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin ‚Üí(c1 /. c2)‚àà Fin)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(c3[ClWWalksN]c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 = { < s0, s1 > |(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà(0[...]c3), s0 =(s1[cyclShift]s2)))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c3)
} = {
  ssfid((c1 /. c2), P(c1), (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  sylib((Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin, P(c1)‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Fin)
  syl5eqel(c1, cfn, (c3[ClWWalksN]c0), (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  clwwlknfi(c0, c3)
  pwfi(c1)
  qsss(c1, c2, (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  a1i((Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin, c2[Er]c1)
  erclwwlkn(s0, s1, s2, c2, c1, c3, c0)
}

blocks.origin:
thm hashclwwlkn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), csu(s0, cqs(c1, c2), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, copab(s1, s2, w3a(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), c1), wrex(s3, co(nat0, cfz, c3), wceq(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), ccsh, cv(s3)))))))

} = {

  diff.cv.s(s4, s0)
  diffss.ex(s4, s0)
}

blocks.name: hashecclwwlkn1
blocks.content: The size of every equivalence class of the equivalence relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words) with a fixed length which is a prime number is 1 or equals this length. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashecclwwlkn1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cqs(c2, c3))), wo(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c0), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cqs(c2, c3))), wo(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0))), diffsc(s1, c1))

  impcom(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cqs(c2, c3)), wo(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0)))
  pm2.43i(wcel(c1, cqs(c2, c3)), wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wo(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0))))

  eqeq2d(c1, crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c4)), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), ccsh, cv(s2))))), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c4)), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfzo, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), ccsh, cv(s2))))), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c4)), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), ccsh, cv(s2))))), crab(hs0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c4)), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfzo, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))), w3a(wcel(cv(hs1), cword(cfv(cvtx, c4))), wne(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(c0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))
  imp(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), c2), w3a(wcel(cv(hs1), cword(cfv(cvtx, c4))), wne(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(c0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))

  diff.hs0.w(c0 =(# ` hs1))
  diff.co.s(s2, nat0, cfzo, c0)

  diff.cfzo.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: umgrhashecclwwlk
blocks.content: The size of every equivalence class of the equivalence relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words) with a fixed length which is a prime number equals this length (in an undirected simple graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-May-2021.)

blocks.name: fusgrhashclwwlkn
blocks.content: The size of the set of closed walks (defined as words) with a fixed length which is a prime number is the product of the number of equivalence classes for ` .~ ` over the set of closed walks and the fixed length. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm fusgrhashclwwlkn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(cfv(chash, c2), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, c3)), cmul, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, c1), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
} = {
  3eqtrd(cfv(chash, c2), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, c3)), cmul, c1), csu(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), csu(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), c1), wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(cfv(chash, c2), csu(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), cfv(chash, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  hashclwwlkn0(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c0, c2, c3, c1)
  sumeq2dv(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c2, c3)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c2, c3)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(c0, cumgr))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c0, cumgr), wcel(c0, cusgr))
  fusgrusgr(c0)
  usgrumgr(c0)
  umgrhashecclwwlk(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, cv(hs0), c2, c3)
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(csu(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), c1), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, c3)), cmul, c1)), wcel(cqs(c2, c3), cfn), wcel(c1, cc))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wcel(cqs(c2, c3), cfn), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfn))
  fusgrvtxfi(c0, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  qerclwwlknfi(s0, s1, s2, c0, c2, c3, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(c1, cc))
  nncnd(c1, wcel(c1, cprime))
  prmnn(c1)
  fsumconst(hs0, cqs(c2, c3), c1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cqs(c2, c3))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
}

thm fusgrhashclwwlkn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime)‚Üí(# ` c2)=((# `(c2 /. c3))[√ó]c1))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c1[ClWWalksN]c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 = { < s0, s1 > |(s0 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà(0[...]c1), s0 =(s1[cyclShift]s2)))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  3eqtrd((# ` c2), ((# `(c2 /. c3))[√ó]c1), sum(hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3),(# ` hs0)), sum(hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3), c1), (c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  syl((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), (# ` c2)= sum(hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3),(# ` hs0)), (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  hashclwwlkn0(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c0, c2, c3, c1)
  sumeq2dv(hs0, (c2 /. c3), (# ` hs0), c1, (c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  imp((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3), (# ` hs0)= c1)
  sylan(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c1 ‚àà Prime, (hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3)‚Üí(# ` hs0)= c1), c0 ‚àà UMGraph)
  syl(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c0 ‚àà UMGraph, c0 ‚àà USGraph)
  fusgrusgr(c0)
  usgrumgr(c0)
  umgrhashecclwwlk(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, hs0, c2, c3)
  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), sum(hs0 ‚àà(c2 /. c3), c1)=((# `(c2 /. c3))[√ó]c1), (c2 /. c3)‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  syl((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), (c2 /. c3)‚àà Fin, (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c1 ‚àà Prime, (Vtx ` c0)‚àà Fin)
  fusgrvtxfi(c0, (Vtx ` c0))
  eqid((Vtx ` c0))
  qerclwwlknfi(s0, s1, s2, c0, c2, c3, c1)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c1 ‚àà Prime, c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  nncnd(c1, c1 ‚àà Prime)
  prmnn(c1)
  fsumconst(hs0, (c2 /. c3), c1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((c2 /. c3))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: clwwlkndivn
blocks.content: The size of the set of closed walks (defined as words) of length ` N ` is divisible by ` N ` if ` N ` is a prime number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 2-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwlkndivn(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(c1, cdvds, cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0))))
} = {

blocks.name: clwlkssizeeq
blocks.content: The size of the set of closed walks as words of length ` N ` corresponds to the size of the set of closed walks of length ` N ` in a simple pseudograph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 26-May-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwlkssizeeq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqcomd(cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)))
  hasheqf1od(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0), universe, cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))), wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)), wcel(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), universe))
  rabex(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1))
  fvex(cclwlks, c0)
  clwlknf1oclwwlkn(hs0, s0, c0, c1, cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))), crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cclwlks, c0)
  diff.cclwlks.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))
}

thm clwlkssizeeq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)‚Üí(# `(c1[ClWWalksN]c0))=(# ` { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqcomd((# `(c1[ClWWalksN]c0)), (# ` { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }), (c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï))
  hasheqf1od({ s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }, (c1[ClWWalksN]c0), universe, (hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 } ‚Ü¶((2nd ` hs0)[prefix](# `(1st ` hs0)))), (c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï))
  a1i((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï), { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  rabex(s0, (ClWalks ` c0), (# `(1st ` s0))= c1)
  fvex(cclwlks, c0)
  clwlknf1oclwwlkn(hs0, s0, c0, c1, (hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 } ‚Ü¶((2nd ` hs0)[prefix](# `(1st ` hs0)))), { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }, (1st ` hs0), (2nd ` hs0))
  eqid((1st ` hs0))
  eqid((2nd ` hs0))
  eqid({ s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 })
  eqid((hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 } ‚Ü¶((2nd ` hs0)[prefix](# `(1st ` hs0)))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cclwlks, c0)
  diff.cclwlks.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 })
}

blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ clwlkssizeeq as of 12-Oct-2022. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 26-May-2022.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm clwlkssizeeqOLD(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqcomd(cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)))
  hasheqf1od(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0), universe, cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), csubstr, cop(nat0, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)))))), wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn)), wcel(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), universe))
  rabex(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1))
  fvex(cclwlks, c0)
  clwlknf1oclwwlknOLD(hs0, s0, c0, c1, cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), csubstr, cop(nat0, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)))))), crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)))
  eqid(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), csubstr, cop(nat0, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cclwlks, c0)
  diff.cclwlks.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))
}

blocks.name: clwlksndivn
blocks.content: The size of the set of closed walks of prime length ` N ` is divisible by ` N ` . This corresponds to statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2: "It follows that, if p is a prime number, then the number of closed walks of length p is divisible by p". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwlksndivn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(c1, cdvds, cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  breqtrd(c1, cdvds, cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1))), cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  clwwlkndivn(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c1, cprime), wceq(cfv(chash, co(c1, cclwwlkn, c0)), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c1)))), wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cn))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c0, cusgr))
  fusgrusgr(c0)
  usgruspgr(c0)
  prmnn(c1)
  clwlkssizeeq(s0, c0, c1)
}

thm clwlksndivn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime)‚Üí c1[||](# ` { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  breqtrd(c1, cdvds, (# ` { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }), (# `(c1[ClWWalksN]c0)), (c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  clwwlkndivn(c0, c1)
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c1 ‚àà Prime, (# `(c1[ClWWalksN]c0))=(# ` { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)|(# `(1st ` s0))= c1 }), c0 ‚àà USPGraph, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  syl(c0 ‚àà FinUSGraph, c0 ‚àà USPGraph, c0 ‚àà USGraph)
  fusgrusgr(c0)
  usgruspgr(c0)
  prmnn(c1)
  clwlkssizeeq(s0, c0, c1)
}
